message: Flagstone Prison was built a few hundred years ago by house Gorland of Stoutford and used right until the Noble Wars when the house was extinguished. This dreadful place has been left abandoned ever since.
For years and years, no one took notice of Flagstone. Except for the occasional reports from travelers of terrible screams coming from the camp.
Flagstone has been overrun by undead, and we are standing guard here to make sure no undead escape.

replies.text: Can you tell me the story about Flagstone?

message: But recently, undead started pouring out of Flagstone and started to threaten Stoutford and the trade routes nearby.
Hello again. Did you enter Flagstone? I am surprised you actually returned.

replies.text: Can you tell me the story again?
There is a guardian in the lower levels of Flagstone that cannot be approached and the former prisoners are undead now.

message: Hello again. It seems something happened inside Flagstone that made the undead weaker. I'm sure we have you to thank for it.

replies.text: In the depths of Flagstone, I had to fight a winged demon and found a prisoner called Narael. He told me that the warden continued running the prison and tortured the prisoners and even experimented with necromancy.

message: A guardian and undead prisoners you say? This is troubling news, since it means there is some larger force behind all this.
You could look out for the former warden. Maybe he has something to do with all of this.

replies.text: Ok, I will go look out for the former warden.

message: Hello again. Have you found the former warden in Flagstone yet?

replies.text: I slew the fomer warden and found a peculiar necklace among his remains.
Can you tell me the story again?
Not yet. I have to keep looking.

message: Oh this looks most interesting. Let's take a look. Hmm. It has got some weird enxriptions on it which say 'Daylight Shadow'. Maybe you could try these words on the demon? So did the warden have something to do with the demon after all?

replies.text: This could work indeed. Thank you.
